From: "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@...>

 
    > 2) My experience is that most people will write a main 
    > that does NOT
    > automatically say, "yes, I passed all my tests". They 
    > generally will print
    > out results, rather than asserting the truth.  The 
    > automatic behavior in
    > unit tests is key.

To further David's point... my experience is that most main()'s test for
best-case scenarios.  They don't fully test the class.

-Jason
subject: RE: [junit] Why bother?
